Have questions about shipping your vehicle?

We know arranging auto transport can feel overwhelming, especially if it’s your first time. That’s why we’ve put together answers to the most common questions our customers ask. From pricing and insurance to pickup and delivery, you’ll find everything you need to feel confident about shipping your car with us.

General Questions

What does a car transport broker do?

▶

As a transport broker, we connect you with licensed, insured carriers who will safely move your vehicle. We don’t own trucks ourselves but work with a trusted network of carriers to secure the best route, price, and timeline for your shipment.

Is my vehicle insured during transport?

▶

Yes. All carriers we work with must have active cargo and liability insurance.

What’s the difference between open and enclosed transport?

▶
  • Open transport: Most common and affordable option; vehicles are shipped on an open carrier trailer.
  • Enclosed transport: Offers extra protection from weather, road debris, and visibility—recommended for luxury, classic, or exotic vehicles.

Do you guarantee pickup and delivery dates?

▶

We provide estimated windows. While carriers strive to stay on schedule, delays due to traffic, weather, or logistics may occur.

Things to Know Before You Begin (Getting a Quote)

What details do I need to get an instant quote?

▶

Pickup/delivery locations, vehicle make and model, transport type, and shipping dates.

How does vehicle size affect my quote?

▶

Larger/heavier vehicles cost more to ship than standard sedans.

Do shipping dates impact pricing?

▶

Yes—flexibility often means better rates. Urgent or guaranteed pickups cost more.

Does location matter?

▶

Yes. Major cities and busy routes are usually cheaper and faster than rural locations.

Can I ship a non-running vehicle?

▶

Yes, but special equipment is needed, which increases cost.

Do modifications affect pricing?

▶

Yes. Lift kits, oversized tires, or racks can change carrier requirements.

Do fuel prices and seasonality affect quotes?

▶

Yes. Rates vary depending on fuel costs and seasonal demand.

Things to Know During and After the Process

How will I know when my car will be picked up?

▶

You’ll get a pickup window (1–3 days) and a confirmation call from the driver.

Can I track my vehicle during transport?

▶

Yes—updates are available by phone or through our team.

What paperwork do I need?

▶

You’ll sign a Bill of Lading at pickup and delivery, which documents vehicle condition.

What should I do at pickup and delivery?

▶

Inspect the car with the driver, note condition, and take photos.

What if my car is damaged?

▶

Note it on the Bill of Lading and report it immediately. Carrier insurance covers repair costs.

How do I pay the balance?

▶

Typically cash, cashier’s check, or money order at delivery. Some carriers accept cards.

What if there’s a delay?

▶

We’ll notify you and coordinate with the carrier to minimize issues.
